website_summaries.verdict: A quality wireless Bluetooth speaker that works with Alexa and provides crisp, clear sound.
pros: Sleek and stylish, it comes in black or white and can be wall-mounted or placed anywhere
Can be paired with other Yamaha speakers or woofers
cons: Price is high despite more recent models available

customer_reviews.title: Nearly Impossible to Set Up
customer_reviews.text: We have a Yamaha Aventage RX-A780 receiver as the driver for a 5.1 home theater system. We were hoping to include these as the wireless surround sound component; however, we found them nearly impossible to set up. I say "nearly" since some reviewers found a way (e.g.15 step process to hard wire the initial set up). The instructions for the RX-A780 and the Musiccast focus on connecting phones and other devices, not so much connecting their own receiver. Our package did not include any user manual. Went to the internet for that. Sent these back. We don't need the aggravation.
customer_reviews.author: Denise McGhee

customer_reviews.title: Very difficult or impossible to set up
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item to work with my home theater system. (A Yamaha receiver) I spent more than 8 hours trying t get these to work. They are junk, do not waste your time. I was able to get one of them to play sound. The sound was underwhelming. The setup was miserable, in fact I never got them setup as surround sound speakers. UPDATE: after doing a factory reset on all Yamaha items, I was able to get them setup. If you are going to use these with your Yamaha Home Theater system, it is important to set up your receiver first.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Surround Sound
customer_reviews.text: I have joined two of these speakers with a Yamaha RX-V485BL receiver for wireless surround sound, along with Monitor Audio Bronze 2 fronts, a Sony center channel, and a Klipsch 10" sub. It was pretty easy to set up and sounds great. In addition to using the system for watching television and movies, I am enjoying listening to 5 channel stereo streamed music.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R.

customer_reviews.title: Top notch audio quality with good features
customer_reviews.text: Yamaha does almost everything right in their audio products.In my experience, the sound performance and amplification gives you a lot of bang for the buck. This music cast speaker works well with the app and does everything advertised. The design flaw that I have encountered with almost all of them is that the function buttons are not lit or made easy to see/feel, so you have to hunt or use trial and error
customer_reviews.author: Jimminy Cricket

customer_reviews.title: Great as surrounds with my yamaha receiver
customer_reviews.text: I am using 2 of these things with my yamaha rx-v685 as surround speakers. I did this instead of wiring all which I neither wanted to pay for nor do myself. The idea of detaching them for a party and moving them to some other location in my home is also a reason.
customer_reviews.author: Hador_NYC

customer_reviews.title: Very good, if you have other Yamaha MusicCast products
customer_reviews.text: I bought this, so I could get rid of my Echo (Alexa kept talking, even though we weren't talking to her... creepy). This speaker sounds better than the Echo (can work with one, if you want), but also is really cool when you sync it with your other Yamaha products. I've got a Yamaha receiver with MusicCast and it's really cool how they can sync up and choose which one is the core source. Now, I can play the same stuff in my kitchen, as I play in my living room, without wires. Also, it does the regular Bluetooth stuff...
customer_reviews.author: Joe Castle

customer_reviews.title: Worse than the older model of this speaker
customer_reviews.text: I have the older model MusicCast speaker which somehow has much better stability than this one. It takes probably 8-10 seconds to connect to this speaker and the signal constantly drops or skips. Lame.
customer_reviews.author: A. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Musiccast 20 is not for TV sound
customer_reviews.text: Everyone should know this speaker is not at all suitable for television home theatre sound. When used for TV sound, It has a terrible echo and sounds like a cheap speaker in a 55 gallon drum. Works fine when playing music only but the price for music alone is not reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Will Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Great rear surround speakers with a Yamaha receiver
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up with my Yamaha receiver using two of these as surround rear speakers. Connection quality is great only a very rare pop from one but 99%+ solid connection. By far better than Polk and another option I tried previously.
customer_reviews.author: Gvan

customer_reviews.title: Great as stereo pair
customer_reviews.text: Aound great work well with Yamaha receivers for a wireless zone. Bought two of these instead of 1 music cast 50 and they sound great as a stereo pair. When you turn them on takes a minute to get it all sinked up but after there on no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Maas

customer_reviews.title: Perfect surround speakers
customer_reviews.text: I followed the install instructions left by another review and they were installed and running within minutes. Sound great as I'm using these for my rear surround speakers. Super happy and they look terrific as well.
customer_reviews.author: Kent

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Quite detailed with good bass, I could not be happier. I haven’t tried it in a surround capacity however as I only have one unit. Mostly use it to play FLAC files from a server.
customer_reviews.author: Guy

customer_reviews.title: Very easy connection
customer_reviews.text: Had recently moved into a new to us home, and didn't want to run wires around the living room. Looked around and found that these were compatible with my Yamaha receiver. Connection was very easy and within a few minutes was enjoying the full surround effect. It did require using the Yamaha MusicCast app to connect, but to me, that made it even easier. Sounds much larger and provides a good overall sound for surround speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Scott A

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to Connect with Musiccast
customer_reviews.text: Frustrating. after all the frustration all I had to do was enable location service for the music cast app. I called technical support on an off day and wait was not bad.
customer_reviews.author: happy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Great sound . Controls are slightly difficult to see ,everything is black. But, it makes it more attractive for placement.
customer_reviews.author: Trey

customer_reviews.title: Great speaker for streaming music.
customer_reviews.text: Great sound. Connected to my wifi. Used the Musicast app from Yamaha. Took some time to get it connected. Once it was set up, streamed Amazom music. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Miller

customer_reviews.title: Good not Great
customer_reviews.text: The sound is good not great. For the price I expected a little more. However it integrates with my current musiccast system so that’s kinda priceless.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product!! Very pricey and constantly lost Bluetooth connection. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Stan Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Good wireless speaker
customer_reviews.text: Sounds pretty good better with Amazon music than the old model
customer_reviews.author: Rick S

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing I love it no problems easy to install everything sound quality is great
customer_reviews.author: Larrywilliams

customer_reviews.title: Come for the wireless, stay for the constant audio cut outs
customer_reviews.text: Would you love one or both speakers to cut out while watching a show? How about cutting out frequently, requiring a factory reset each time this happens? Then you will *love* this speaker!
customer_reviews.author: Bernie Lowe

customer_reviews.title: Neighborhood Disturbance
customer_reviews.text: We love it. It is great to be able to listen to Sirus XM anywhere around the house. We use it a lot on our patio as well. Great when we are in the hot tub.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Hamblen

customer_reviews.title: Not a good wireless surround speaker solution.
customer_reviews.text: Bought them solely to use as surround speakers. Ridiculously difficult to pair with Yamaha musiccast receiver. So far this purchase is a bust. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: theodore j jiggetts

customer_reviews.title: A great choice!
customer_reviews.text: Killer sound. Balanced high end, mids, and bass response. Fills a room really well! I love being able to sync it to my Yamaha reciever via the MusicCast app. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You can integrate to your Yamaha receiver
customer_reviews.text: Sounds incredibly big considering how small it is . Love it
customer_reviews.author: DANA SARANDRIA

customer_reviews.title: Quality Sound
customer_reviews.text: Amazing sound for what you pay. Yamaha is a very good brand for everything. Love them
customer_reviews.author: Rod Pugh

customer_reviews.title: poor sound
customer_reviews.text: is the most I can give, the system several times does not recognize the speakers, very expensive for how poor they sound
customer_reviews.author: Mario E. Larrauri W. BM-6708

customer_reviews.title: A Bluetooth speaker without a rechargeable battery
customer_reviews.text: The speaker has little weak base sound but considering the size of the speaker it is not so bad. However I am surprised to find this one does not have a rechargeable battery inside. It has a cable with a 120Vac plug and I have to plug it to the outlet all the time. Judging by the product picture and current trend of other bluetooth speakers, I assumed this speaker would have a battery. My fault but I just want share my finding with other.
customer_reviews.author: James K

customer_reviews.title: Try something else
customer_reviews.text: Displeased with sound and max volume . Will have to purchase a different wireless speaker Not easy to synch and set up . Should be easier with yamaha receiver
customer_reviews.author: JC from NY

customer_reviews.title: Update your firmware
customer_reviews.text: So, I started on this review with some negative feelings, saw a few other reviewers comment about updating the firmware (through the app) and....lo and behold, it's working far better. 1. Bluetooth connectivity with my phone is working quite well. 2. Sound quality is good. Now, to the not-great parts: I'm not a fan of needing one more app for this to work well. There's nothing really impressive with the Musicast app and service. So, as a speaker, it's good. As anything more, I'm not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Hibbard

customer_reviews.title: Garbage. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy these unless you feel like paying $200 for a glorified Bluetooth speaker. MusicCast is absolute garbage. I cannot emphasize enough how terrible it is. It NEVER works. I've spent literal HOURS trying to connect this speaker to my WiFi network only to find the next time I want to use it that the app once again "can't find" the speaker. My router says it's connected to the network, but I still can't use it because, and I want to make sure this is clear, MUSICCAST IS GARBAGE AND DOESN'T WORK.
customer_reviews.author: J.P. Conques

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, small footprint
customer_reviews.text: While it looks like a biggish barrel in the photos, it is actually smaller than you think. The sound is very good, and fills my lab of over 50'x100', and has good enough base that music does not sound tinny and carries well even over the hum of the HVAC and lab hoods. The Yamaha software was hard to get going on the phone, but you can by-pass it by blue tooth hookup with a smart phone and be off immediately. Overall, if you are looking for a portable, small-footprint and good sounding speaker, give this some serious consideration.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan W. Ong

customer_reviews.title: Set Up Hell
customer_reviews.text: You can read the poor reviews and I have now experienced them twice. I bought these speakers from Yamaha and if you check their web site you'll see this model number is no where to be found. That should tell you something. As a certified buyer I was able to leave a one star review which I was also unable to find. If you're attempting to set these up as rear wireless speakers with your Yamaha receiver I wish you luck with the app and Yamaha support.
customer_reviews.author: William G. Creel

customer_reviews.title: Music in living room again
customer_reviews.text: I got rid of my living room stereo system and I don’t like the sound of music from my sound bar. This speaker is easily hidden behind my tv. I use it to broadcast via Bluetooth from my phone. Sound is pretty good and it can fill the room. Setup with Bluetooth and WiFi was easy. Yamaha app for setup is quite simple. No battery so not a mobile speaker.
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl L. Katz

customer_reviews.title: Superb sound
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this just as a wireless speaker for music from my phone. It's fantastic! Has a great sound with a good bass thump for a single speaker. Umm looking forward to getting a 2nd one, so I can connect it to one of our TVs. It was easy to connect, which is a plus. I definitely will be looking at other Yamaha audio equipment in the future, when I need it. Superb sound.
customer_reviews.author: MH

customer_reviews.title: Install Nightmare
customer_reviews.text: Have had a single speaker for 6 weeks. After spending hrs connecting to my RX A860 receiver the speaker has dropped wifi continually. Every time it powers off it loses connection. Worthless tech support. Returning today
customer_reviews.author: clh

product_meta.title: Yamaha WX-021 MusicCast 20 Wireless Speaker, Alexa Voice Control, Black
product_meta.description: The MusicCast 20 makes your music and movies more enjoyable - maybe in ways you never imagined. it's a perfect fit for any space, any decor, and can even be wall-mounted. Pair two together to create a powerful wireless stereo sound. The MusicCast app makes your MusicCast 20 even more versatile. Add a pair to a MusicCast surround-capable AV receiver to provide wireless Surrounds for a 5. 1-Channel home theater system. Or listen to music in any room in your home with a MusicCast multi-room setup. Voice control with Alexa through any echo device adds more flexibility for your life.
feature_bullets: Fits any space and style of room, even wall Mountable

Stream your favorite music through Wi Fi, Bluetooth, airplay or Spotify connect. Bluetooth Version/Profile - Ver. 4.2 + EDR / A2DP, AVRCP (Bluetooth is compatible with SCMS-T.). Audio Codec - SBC, AAC* (*receiving only). Maximum Communication Range - 32 feet. 10 in. (without interference)
Completes your wireless MusicCast stereo or multi room setup; Stream and control multiple rooms with the MusicCast app for iOS and Android
MusicCast stereo/surround capable; Add a pair to a MusicCast surround capable AV receiver to provide wireless Surrounds for a 5.1 Channel home theater system
Voice control with Alexa via any echo device

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars112 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
